nodes.text: A panda was distinct from a bantha, which was a species of mammals native to the planet Tatooine. In the planet's Jundland Wastes in 0 BBY, as the protocol droid C-3PO accompanied his master—a local moisture farmer named Luke Skywalker—in search of his astromech droid, R2-D2, Skywalker audibly confirmed the presence of several banthas nearby while peering through a pair of macrobinoculars. Due to his excitement, he did not consider whether C-3PO was able to distinguish a bantha from a panda.
Soon after in the same year, the Rebel Alliance deployed a pair of Lambda-class T-4a shuttles named Panda to capture the Galactic Empire frigate Priam.
Panda was first mentioned in the 1977 Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope novelization by Alan Dean Foster. It is one of multiple references to real world wildlife in Star Wars media.
